newsitem.title: FRANCE: French aero stocks take off on Airbus deal.
newsitem.headline: French aero stocks take off on Airbus deal.

text.p: French aerospace shares rose on the Paris stock exchange on Thursday on the back of USAir's record order for 120 planes at Airbus Industrie, analysts said.
At 1436 GMT, Labinal gained 5.6 percent at 887 francs, Zodiac 2.23 percent at 1,556 francs and Intertechnique 3.80 percent at 820 francs.
Dassault Electronique, plus 4.62 percent, and Dassault Aviation, plus 6.64 percent, were also up but dealers said this was not related to Airbus.

"French aerospace companies such as Labinal, Zodiac and Intertechnique supply to Airbus but also to Boeing. Whenever there is a bid order for the one or the other they benefit from it," said Bertrand Larcena of brokers Oddo.
Transbourse's Jacques de Greling said Zodiac, which makes passenger evacuation slides and seats as well as inflatable dinghies, was "the best way to invest in the aerospace sector."
He said Zodiac was trading at 43 times its 1995/96 earnings.
"That's expensive but there are not many companies that can gurantee an annual growth rate of 15 percent in earnings per share," he added.
